item.title: Google fixes actively exploited sandbox escape zero day in Chrome
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Google has released a security update for Chrome to address half a dozen vulnerabilities, one of them actively exploited by attackers to escape the browser's sandbox protection. [...]

item.title: OpenAI's image model gets built-in style feature on ChatGPT
item.dc:creator: Mayank Parmar
item.description: OpenAI's image gen model, which is available via ChatGPT for free, now lets you easily create AI images even if you're not familiar with trends or prompt engineering. [...]

item.title: Abacus dark web drug market goes offline in suspected exit scam
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Abacus Market, the largest Western darknet marketplace supporting Bitcoin payments, has shut down its public infrastructure in a move suspected to be an exit scam. [...]

item.title: Windows KB5064489 emergency update fixes Azure VM launch issues
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: Microsoft has released an emergency update to fix a bug that prevents Azure virtual machines from launching when the Trusted Launch setting is disabled and Virtualization-Based Security (VBS) is enabled. [...]

item.title: North Korean XORIndex malware hidden in 67 malicious npm packages
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: North Korean threat actors planted 67 malicious packages in the Node Package Manager (npm) online repository to deliver a new malware loader called XORIndex to developer systems. [...]

item.title: Police disrupt “Diskstation” ransomware gang attacking NAS devices
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: An international law enforcement action dismantled a Romanian ransomware gang known as 'Diskstation,' which encrypted the systems of several companies in the Lombardy region, paralyzing their businesses. [...]

item.title: Android malware Konfety uses malformed APKs to evade detection
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: A new variant of the Konfety Android malware emerged with a malformed ZIP structure along with other obfuscation methods that allow it to evade analysis and detection. [...]

item.title: OpenAI's ChatGPT-powered browser is codenamed 'Aura'
item.dc:creator: Mayank Parmar
item.description: OpenAI is following Perplexity and is working on its own AI-powered browser codenamed "Aura." [...]

item.title: UK launches vulnerability research program for external experts
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: UK's National Cyber Security Centre (NCSC) has announced a new Vulnerability Research Initiative (VRI) that aims to strengthen relations with external cybersecurity experts. [...]

item.title: Interlock ransomware adopts new FileFix attack to push malware
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Hackers have adopted the new technique called 'FileFix' in Interlock ransomware attacks to drop a remote access trojan (RAT) on targeted systems. [...]

item.title: Gigabyte motherboards vulnerable to UEFI malware bypassing Secure Boot
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Dozens of Gigabyte motherboard models run on UEFI firmware vulnerable to security issues that allow planting bootkit malware that is invisible to the operating system and can survive reinstalls. [...]

item.title: Malicious VSCode extension in Cursor IDE led to $500K crypto theft
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: A fake extension for the Cursor AI IDE code editor infected devices with remote access tools and infostealers, which, in one case, led to the theft of $500,000 in cryptocurrency from a Russian crypto developer. [...]

item.title: Windows 10 KB5062554 update breaks emoji panel search feature
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: The search feature for the Windows 10 emoji panel is broken after installing the KB5062554 cumulative update released Tuesday, making it not possible to look up emojis by name or keyword. [...]
